content:
Mat Ryer is back! He plays the piano, we tell each other truths/lies, we pay homage to the 8" floppy disk, Mat accepts an open source medal, and so much more. It's a real circus. MatGPT! :link: https://changelog.com/friends/75

Is there an unbleeped f-word here?

https://changelog.com/friends/75#t=25:29

I'm not offended or anything, but I know you guys like to keep things clean :big_smile:

James Thurley said:

Is there an unbleeped f-word here?

https://changelog.com/friends/75#t=25:29

I'm not offended or anything, but I know you guys like to keep things clean :big_smile:

Sounds more like just a vocal thing to me, don't think the intention here was anything cuss-y
Yeah, I can’t imagine Jerod inserting a swear there :big_smile:

Or Adam, to be clear. I just realised I can’t imagine any of you two swearing at all :big_smile:
It took me a while to get to this point, but I really appreciate that Changelog pods are clean and especially that you two don’t even need to be bleeped out. That’s how a host of topical podcast should talk, not like a dockworker or a college freshman :sunglasses: :thumbs_up:

I don't mind either way - just in terms of furthest reach and accessibility to younger audiences who may be interested, people with different backgrounds and preferences, the measured good vibes are clearly working. ;) I also appreciate the editorial decision to leave some in sometimes with a warning, like Corey Doctorow episodes talking about Enshittification and just his use of profanity as a fairly important part of it
Has there been any consideration given to creating a BMC mix of some of Mat's finest work? Or a collab?

Adam, I was baffled when you said it’s not actually “take my strong hand”. Flat out didn’t believe you in fact. Then I looked it up.

I learn something new every time I listen to this podcast :joy:

@Fershad Irani it has crossed our minds, but we've never done anything about it. One challenge with that is Mat's songs for us are so contextual to the conversation that when you extract them as standalones, they don't hit quite as hard....

But still, I do like the idea
I was freaking out looking up Mandela Effect examples last night. I could have sworn there was a Shazam movie starring Sinbad...

Lars Ellingsen said:

I was freaking out looking up Mandela Effect examples last night. I could have sworn there was a Shazam movie starring Sinbad...

Same! What is reality

Had a Mandella Effect this week. My brother and I were texting about the guy who shoots lightning in Mortal Combat.

I kept spelling it "Raiden" (which is what Wikipedia told me to do). He kept writing "Rayden". I had to be like "no, Rayden's a spanish rapper" (again, according to Wikipedia). It's entirely possible he was just wrong, but if you thought it had a Y, let me know.
I was a BIG fan of Raiden back in the day... never heard of Rayden :sunglasses:
